title: Personal Website
subtitle: Personal project
description: Built this website from scratch using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: Astronomy Research
subtitle: UBC Computer Science Department
description: Developed ML models and frameworks to process spectra data from the ESA's Gaia telescope. Utilized a large astronomy dataset and HPC clusters to accelerate and scale the data processing. Collaborated closely with a team of experts, presenting progress updates and proposing new ideas. Contributed to a cutting-edge software pipeline for spectra-to-stellar parameters in astrophysics, achieving a more complete map of chemical evolution in the Milky Way galaxy.

title: Digital Systems and Microcomputers Course Projects
subtitle: UBC Computer Engineering 312
description: VHDL and assembly projects for CPEN 312.

title: Photogrammetry Accuracy Investigation
subtitle: Craig Hospital
description: Meshes generated from photos. Comparable in detail and resolution to an expensive structured light scanner. OpenCV and Python to capture images from a multi-camera array. Open source AliceVision Python pipeline to generate mesh. Compared generated meshes with scans from a structured light scanner. Photogrammetry meshes had .19 mm of average mesh error. System cost 85% less than a structured light scanner.
